result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desean L. Dowell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Desean L. Dowell in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Desean L. Dowell.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 11-29-2022 and all responses to be filed by 12-27-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial SUPERVISION Report 11.01.2022

Defendant Desean L. Dowell in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Desean L. Dowell.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-3-2022

Defendant Desean L. Dowell in court in person with attorney Michael J Cerniglia by video.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Hayes. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-9-2022

Defendant Desean L. Dowell in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Desean L. Dowell in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Michael Cerniglia

Court ordered no contact with RDA (DOB 10/28/1971)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Desean L. Dowell in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Desean L. Dowell in custody.  Nate Mcclure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
